RelatedSentence: A bill needs to be passed in parliament - the ' Party Loyalty Bill ' .
The bill must ensure that a person elected from one party must remain in the party for at least 10 years so that their performance can be checked .
Many candidates change their parties at the end of a government 's tenure .

A member of parliament gets many perks and privileges in terms of salary , development funds , cars , air fare and foreign trips etc. It is important to see how they worked when they had a portfolio and the next job is given in accordance with the performance shown .

If a parliamentarian changes his party in every election , how will anyone judge his performance ?
If a parliamentarian changes his party in every election , how will anyone judge his performance ?
In the last 20 years , many candidates were elected from the same constituency again and again but none of them actually did any kind of work .
They just changed their party every election in order to keep winning the seat in the assembly .
